column1: When she was close to the water she waved her wand
column2: and in a second a thousand boats
column4: shot up from beneath the lake and set their bows against the bank. The queen and Cuglas stepped into one
column5: and when they were seated two fairy harpers took their places in the prow. All the other boats were soon thronged by fairies
column6: and then the queen waved her wand again
column7: and an awning of purple silk rose over the boat
column8: and silken awnings of various colors over the others
column9: and the royal boat moved off from the bank followed by all the rest
column10: and in every boat sat a harper with a golden harp
column11: and when the queen waved her wand for the third time
column12: the harpers struck the trembling chords
column13: and to the sound of the delightful music the boats glided over the sunlit lake.
